required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Pre-dinner vs. Post-dinner Exercise on Glycemic Control
clinical_study.official_title: Exercise Timing and Postprandial Glycemia in Type 2 Diabetes

brief_summary.textblock: With many medications we prescribe them relative to time of day or a meal. This study established if pre dinner vs post dinner exercise was more effective at altering post dinner glucose and triglyceride levels vs no exercise at all.

detailed_description.textblock: All participants completed three trials in a random order in which they consumed a standardized dinner meal with 1) no RE (NoRE), 2) pre-dinner RE (RE→M), and 3) post-dinner RE beginning 45 min after dinner (M→RE). Diet was standardized during the day of testing. Participants reported to the lab for testing sometime between 3 - 5:30 p.m. and upon arrival a venous catheter was inserted into a forearm vein. Frequent blood sampling, indirect calorimetry measurements, and subjective well-being measurements ensued for ~5.75 h while the participants were in the lab.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were taken every 5-10 min during the first 3.7 h of testing and every 30 min during the last 2 h

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were taken every 5-10 min during the first 3.7 h of testing and every 30 min during the last 2 h

other_outcome.time_frame: Blood samples were taken every 5-10 min during the first 3.7 h of testing and every 30 min during the last 2 h

arm_group.description: participants will remain sedentary during testing
45 min of resistance training will be performed after a standard meal
45 min of resistance training will be performed prior to a standard meal

intervention.description: During the no exercise trial (NoEX), the participants will remain sedentary during testing.
During the post-meal exercise trial (M→EX), 45 min of resistance training will be performed
During the exercise prior to the meal trial (EX→M), 45 min of resistance training will be performed

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Obese ( body mass index 30-45 kg/m2)
- Physician diagnosed with type 2 diabetes receiving standard medical care
- Non-smokers
- Pregnancy
- Lactating mothers
Exclusion Criteria:
- Insulin
- Surgical weight loss
- Orthopedic limitations to exercise
- Weight loss in the previous 3 months
